description: This sculpture of Aphrodite, the Greek goddess of love and sexuality, is a Roman version of a renowned Greek statue known as the Aphrodite of Knidos. The original sculpture, carved in the mid-fourth century BCE, was acclaimed for its daring and innovative representation of the goddess: it was the first monumental nude depiction of a female deity in the classical Greek world.
title: Statue of the Aphrodite of Knidos
